value.title: Maxton, N.C., Pursues Funding for Facial Recognition Tech
value.excerpt: For almost four years, the small town of Maxton, N.C., has tried to get funding for a surveillance system that uses facial recognition. Officials want to continue working with a software company to secure funding.

value.title: State to use facial recognition at Honolulu Airport to speed up travel time for international visitors
value.excerpt: The state plans to spend $15 million to install facial recognition cameras on departure gates at the Daniel K Inouye International Airport, a project aimed at speeding up the screening

value.title: Why this face recognition firm is so controversial
value.excerpt: Clearview AI is arguably the best known and most controversial facial recognition company in the world. It's been at the centre of battles over privacy, personal data and freedom. BBC North America tech reporter James Clayton spoke to Hoan Ton-That,

value.title: Hyundai chooses IonQ's quantum tech to improve its vehicles' object recognition capabilities
value.excerpt: The automaker hopes the quantum machine learning services of IonQ can help it improve its 3D object detection safety systems for drivers and autonomous vehicles.

value.title: Ukraine has used facial recognition tech to notify Russian families of dead soldiers: report
value.excerpt: Facial recognition technology has been used to notify the families of nearly 600 Russian soldiers who were killed while fighting in Ukraine.

value.title: GSA looks into facial recognition bias and improving accessibility in federal web services
value.excerpt: The U.S. General Services Administration, which procures and investigates tech for things like government websites and online services, is making a two-pronged push for accessibility in its recently released Equity Action Plan.

value.title: Internet Aghast at AI Facial Recognition Used to Identify Dead Russian Soldiers
value.excerpt: Reporters and readers reacted to the news that Ukraine is using facial recognition AI software to identify dead soldiers Russia left behind.

value.title: Ukraine is using facial recognition to ID dead Russian soldiers and send photos of corpses home to their moms: report
value.excerpt: Facial recognition technology, donated by a controversial US firm, is part of a gruesome campaign to shock everyday Russians into opposing the war.

value.title: CyberLink Announces the Integration of Its FaceMe® Security Facial Recognition Software with AXIS Camera Station
value.excerpt: CyberLink Corp. (5203.TW), a pioneer of AI and facial recognition technologies, today announced an important update to its facial recognition security software, FaceMe® Security. value.title: House lawmakers investigating gov't use of facial recognition software

value.title: House panels probe government use of facial recognition software following security concerns
value.excerpt: Facial recognition software was most recently used by the IRS, but that was stopped after lawmakers and privacy advocates raised concerns.

value.title: Facial Recognition Goes to War
value.excerpt: Services that put a name to a face, including Clearview AI, are being used to identify Russian soldiers, living or dead, and to verify that travelers in Ukraine are who they claim.

value.title: Deci Boosts Computer Vision & NLP Models’ Performance at MLPerf
value.excerpt: Deci, the deep learning company harnessing Artificial Intelligence (AI) to build AI, announced its results for both Computer Vision (CV) and Natural Language Processing (NLP) inference models that were submitted to the MLPerf v2.

value.title: Receive notifications for image analysis with Amazon Rekognition Custom Labels and analyze predictions
value.excerpt: Amazon Rekognition Custom Labels is a fully managed computer vision service that allows developers to build custom models to classify and identify objects in images that are specific and unique to your business. Rekognition Custom Labels doesn’t require you to have any prior computer vision expertise.

value.title: Europe Is Building a Huge International Facial Recognition System
value.excerpt: Lawmakers advance proposals to let police forces across the EU link their photo databases—which include millions of pictures of people’s faces.

value.title: Facial recognition system to be launched at Pune airport in 2023
value.excerpt: A facial recognition system will be launched at Pune's Lohegaon Airport by March 2023, Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh said in Parliament. The system will be launched as part of the Centre's Digi Yatra initiative to provide passengers "seamless and hassle-free experience at airports".
